author: LAKE SUN newsroom@lakesunonline.com
title: Lake Area Fall Festivals
text: Posted Sep. 8, 2015 at 6:00 PM   8, 2015 at 6:00 PM Lake Area St James Grape and Fall Festival St. James Sept. 10 - Sept. 12 St. James' 82nd annual Grape and Fall Festival features three days of family fun that ranges from the unique to the area, like the grape stomp, to classic fun to enjoy such as the carnival. Attendees can enjoy a street market, queen pageant, 4-H and FFA livestock show and sale, Lucy Wortham James exhibits, kids' games, carnival, live entertainment, demolition derby, wine and beer garden and even a parade. For more information and full schedule of events visit http://www.stjameschamber.net/# !grape-and-fall-festival/cxos Fall Festival Osage Beach Sept. 12 The City of Osage Beach Fall Festival is from 10 a.m.-5 p.m. at Osage Beach City Park. Free kids’ activities, a petting zoo, demonstrations, displays, a dog contest and other entertainment will be held all day. For more information, go to www.osagebeach.org . Lake of the Ozarks Air Show Camdenton Sept. 12 The Lake of the Ozarks Air Show will be held at the Camdenton Airport all day. Several acts including skydivers, a wing walker, and other entertainment is planned. Rain date is September 13. For a full list of scheduled performers go to www.lakeoftheozarksairshow.com . Bikefest Lake of the Ozarks Sept. 17- Sept. 20 The 9th annual Lake of the Ozarks Bikefest will be held at several venues. Live music, contests, demonstrations, vendor villages, a passport run with a bike give-a-way, and shows will be held. Vendor Village participants are Lake of the Ozarks Harley Davidson, Dog Days, The campground below Bagnell Dam, and H. Toad’s. For a full schedule go to www.lakebikefe Dixon Cow Days Dixon Sept. 18 - Sept. 19 Dixon's annual Cow Days festival will be held in downtown Dixon. The festival features live entertainment on the town square, food and craft vendors, cow giveaways, karaoke, parade, kids games, corn hold tournament, pageant and plenty of things to interest the entire family. For information and a schedule of events visit https://www.facebook.com/pages/Dixon-Chamber-of-Commerce Celebration of Nations Rolla Sept. 26 Celebrating its sixth year, the festival will take place from 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. in downtown Rolla. This multicultural event, features live music and dance; ethnic food, arts, crafts and displays; and plenty of fun for the children. Celebration of Nations gives area residents and Missouri S&T students a chance to showcase and celebrate the vibrant cultural diversity that makes Rolla unique to the Ozarks. For more information, visit http://nations.mst.edu/ Page 2 of 3 - Turkey Festival Eldon Sept. 26 The Turkey Festival in the city of Eldon will be held. A 5K, parade, food, car show, and other events are planned each year. Go to www.eldonchamber.com for a full list of activities and to register for the 5K Turkey Trot. Jacob's Cave Fall Swapping Days Versailles Oct. 1- Oct. 4 Swaps will be from 8 a.m.-3 p.m. Traders and guests set up camp or just browse through a variety of crafts, goods, livestock and various items at this popular event. For additional information go online to www.jacobscave.com , or call 573-378-4374 for vendor booth costs. Apple Festival Versailles Oct. 2 - Oct. 3 The Old Tyme Apple Festival is held in Versailles. Most activities are held around the downtown area. There will be a special play hosted at the Royal Theater, events at the Morgan County Museum, vendors, games and other entertainment. Go to www.versailleschamber.com/applefestival . Frogtober Fest Waynesville Oct. 3 Waynesville hosts a unique festival to be held Oct. 3, beginning at 10 a.m., called Frogtober Fest. The 18th annual Frogtober Fest is sort of a mix up of Octoberfest and Waynesville's former annual Frog Fest. During this festival attendees will see Waynesville's famous frog, Croaker, being celebrated with a frog kissing contest, frog races and frog legs available to eat. Additionally, Frogtober Fest features live entertainment, children's games, crafts and other festival attractions. For more information about Frogtober Fest visit https://www.facebook.com/frogtober.fest?fref=ts on Facebook. Gearhead Bash Richland Oct. 10 If you're into cars, trucks and anything with a motor, the Gearhead Bash is for you. The Gearhead Bash is held in Richland's Shady Dell Park near the swimming pool on Oct. 10 from 3 to 8 p.m. This unique festival features classic and suped-up vehicles of all types available for the public to see, as well as concessions, a live band, a free movie, trophies and plaques for entries. Entry fee is $1 for attendees 12 years and older and a $10 entry fee per vehicle. For more information contact Mark Decker at 573-855-4828 or Beth Myers at 573-765-3636. Old Iron Works Days Maramec Spring Park Oct. 10 - Oct. 11 The 37th Old Iron Works Days will feature more than 100 different crafters demonstrating around 40 crafts that date back to the 1800's. Many demonstrations allow patrons to participate and attendees can learn about quilting, blacksmithing, carving wood for various purposes and many other necessary crafts for life in the 1800's. In addition to the craft part of the festival, there is also live entertainment which will include the Ozark Spirit Cloggers and Clifty Creek Bluegrass Bands. For more information call the James Foundation at 573-265-7124. Page 3 of 3 - Apple Butter Days Linn Creek Oct. 16 - Oct. 17 Camden County Museum’s Fall Festival/Apple Butter Days is from 9 a.m.-5 p.m. They will have craft booths, craft demonstrations, a quilt raffle, apple butter a chili supper, and apple pies available. Admission is free. Chili and soup lunch available for donation. For information or booth availability, call 573-3467191 or visit www.camdencountymuseum.com . Downtown Arts and Crafts Rolla Oct. 24 This will be the 37th year for Rolla’s Downtown Arts and Crafts Festival. The festival is set to be held Saturday, Oct. 24 from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. on the streets of downtown Rolla. Artists and craft vendors from all around the local area will set up booths along the streets featuring items like paintings, pottery, jewelry, wood carvings, toys, prints, clothing, items for the home and furniture. Additionally, food of all kinds will be available to purchase as you stroll down the streets and browse more than 75 different food and craft booths. Pumpkin Fest Waynesville Oct. 31 Pumpkin Fest is a Halloween festival sponsored by area churches and is held every year on Halloween in Waynesville City Park. This well-attended festival is free and open to the public and is often the first stop parents make before taking their children trick-or-treating. Pumpkin Fest features carnival style games, live entertainment, food and treats of all types, loads of entertainment, a hay ride, pumpkins and of course, candy. Everything is free and the community is encouraged to attend, in costume, and enjoy safe Halloween activities. Pumpkin Fest usually runs between 5 p.m. and 8 p.m. By LAKE SUN
